comment._content: If this is celebrating a gold record, perhaps the dark suits on either side of Frankie Laine are Mercury Records executives. I've been searching for recognizable photos of Irving Green and Art (Arthur) Talmadge and failing. There are some photos of Berle Adams, the third co-founder. Billboard of Jul 19, 1947 books.google.com/books?id=VgwEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA22 indicates that Berle Adams left the label in mid-1947. www.spectropop.com/remembers/IrvingGreen.htm has a picture of an elderly Green with a nose that could match either of these. Record makers and breakers: voices of the independent rock 'n' roll pioneers. By John Broven books.google.com/books?id=uFrYsNvmrvQC has a lot about the three men. The author interviewed Adams, Page 25 indicates that Green was an "imposing man physically and in personality." The book has a picture on page 53 of Green with Frankie Laine and Vic Damone (Courtesy Showtime Music Productions) and a photo of Berle Adams -- but they don't show in Google Books for copyright reasons.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Finally, books.google.com/books?id=NBYEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA10 Billboard Jul 15, 2006, page 10 has pictures of Green and Talmadge. Based on them, I reckon that Talmadge is the shorter guy at left. And the big guy could certainly be Green.
